                                         3875

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 28, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the  education  law,  in  relation  to  school  district
         adjusted  gross  income  for  purposes  of determining the alternative
         pupil wealth ratio and combined wealth ratio

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subparagraph 1 of paragraph b of subdivision 3 of section
    2  3602 of the education law, as amended by section 13 of part B of chapter
    3  57 of the laws of 2008, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (1) "Alternate pupil wealth ratio" shall mean the number  computed  to
    5  three  decimals without rounding obtained when the adjusted gross income
    6  of a school district for the calendar year two years prior to the calen-
    7  dar year in which the base year began divided by the total wealth  pupil
    8  units of such district is divided by the statewide adjusted gross income
    9  per  total  wealth  pupil  unit. Such statewide average gross income per
   10  pupil shall be established each year by the commissioner  and  shall  be
   11  transmitted to school districts. Such statewide average shall be rounded
   12  to the nearest hundredth and shall include the adjusted gross income and
   13  total wealth pupil units of all school districts eligible for aid pursu-
   14  ant  to  this  section  except  central  high  school districts. For the
   15  purposes of calculating such statewide average the  data  for  the  city
   16  school  district  of  the  city of New York shall be citywide data.  THE
   17  CALCULATION OF THE ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME OF A SCHOOL DISTRICT SHALL  NOT
   18  INCLUDE  THE ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME OF THE ONE-HALF OF ONE PERCENT OF THE
   19  TAXPAYERS IN SUCH SCHOOL DISTRICT WHO HAVE THE GREATEST  ADJUSTED  GROSS
   20  INCOMES, AND SHALL NOT INCLUDE THE ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME OF THE ONE-HALF
   21  OF  ONE  PERCENT  OF  THE TAXPAYERS IN SUCH SCHOOL DISTRICT WHO HAVE THE
   22  LOWEST ADJUSTED GROSS INCOMES.
   23    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07500-01-1
